content: @T-release meeting!
alright
I wanted to start off by taking a moment to update on the retrospective work from last week, and generally the plans there

The current plan after today's morning compiler team meeting is that there will be a blog post in just over a week informing people that we believe the majority of incremental bugs are fixed on beta, and that we'd like people to test it out. Felix will be helping to draft that; a draft should be available by thursday next week
There will not at this time be a 1.52.2 release, I think.

I think @Pietro Albini has landed (or at least its in queue) some work to ensure we're merging into the right branch, which should help with making sure we're not accidentally merging into the wrong place during release week.
yep! it's in the queue
I plan to spend time over the next few weeks on adding the builders etc that we had discussed
So I think we're in pretty good shape on that work
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
alright, the next thing is the 1.53 blog post
@XAMPPRocky I don't think I've seen the release notes yet - do you have an expectation of when those will be up?
Iâ€™m starting the relnotes this weekend/next week now that the anniversary post is finished up.
Sounds great.
I expect that I'll write the blog post again this time around unless someone else has the availability to do so.
IntoIterator for [T; N] is a big one to feature
I'll kick off a thread soon on that, maybe after release notes are out. Definitely agreed on that one.
I expect there will be at least a partial update/indication of expected stability given 1.52, and perhaps a renewed set of instructions on how to report bugs
alright, I think that's all on the blog post

One thing I was wondering about to maybe make it easier for other people to get on board with help writing the post.

What about in the next meeting after the relnotes, we discuss what we want to highlight in the post, save that as an outline, and then someone takes that from there and fleshes it out with examples and explainers?
I have no objections to that; we sort of follow a similar process today (just discussion is more async), at least for the last few cycles.
Alright --
@triagebot end-topic

Does anyone have something to add on the current topic?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if not.
ok, as a broader update on 1.53 -- crater is now running, but it'll be some time likely
but I think we're on track so far.
I think there are no further topics, unless someone has something to bring up, let's see; @triagebot end-meeting

Does anyone have something to bring up?
React with :working_on_it: if you have something to say.
React with :all_good: if you're ready to end the meeting.
alright, sounds like that's all for today - thanks everyone!
